results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: Aaron Rogers, Luke Dunn Gielmuda and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Sometime in the early 50S the Soviet Space Agency launched Project Vlad. Details are sketchy, but it was a top secret mission. Shrouded in secrecy, few records were kept and the Project has since been all but forgotten…”
Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee cosmonaut. Sent into orbit as a prelude to manned space flight, his hopes for heroism have long since faded. Vlad is a victim of Cold War politics; a long forgotten anachronism whose fate is to trace an endless and lonely trajectory around the Earth.
Project Vlad was created digitally on a Silicon Graphics O2/Infinite Reality Engine using Maya 1.5 and Flame 5.5 software. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder.

results.title: Mozzie
results.creator_credit: Dylan Yeo, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Spectacular animation about fluorocarbons, global warming and radical brain surgery. An evil entrepreneur discovers the real price of his actions. Combined live action and computer animation. Written, directed and animated by Dylan Yeo. Original format 35mm/colour.

results.title: Midas
results.creator_credit: Niki Bern, Isabel Perez and AFTRS
results.brief_description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.

results.title: My grandfather's country
results.creator_credit: Edie Terrick, Elaine Terrick, Lisa Roberts and Poogie Hayes
results.brief_description:
Elaine Terrick’s mum, Edie Terrick, takes a journey back to the place she calls her grandfather’s country - in the mountainous ranges of Gippsland, Victoria. A place where her grandfather survived the slaughtering of his aboriginal people and where he as an abandoned child was found by white people - the O’Rourke family - taken in and brought up as an O’Rourke. For Edie it is an emotional but rewarding journey. Contains beautiful images of the high country and of the “place” where Edi’s grandfather grew up.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: A Magic place
results.creator_credit: David Briggs, Kathy Whelan, Linton Briggs and Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE
results.brief_description:
Narrated to a background of archival home movie images juxtaposed with contemporary images of Lake Mokoan and the surrounding landscape, local resident Linton Briggs gives his account of the changes which have taken place since the decommissioning of the Lake. He speaks of a magic place, Winton Swamp, where wildlife was in abundance, where a wet-land ecosystem of bird-life, Murray cod, Red-gums, and every variety of duck imaginable used to exist and of his sadness and apprehension the changing of the lake may make to the ecological balance of Lake Mokoan.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Little echo lost
results.creator_credit: Armagan Ballantyne, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The EchoMan has never questioned his existence till now. One day he witnesses an event that brings into question everything he stands for and believes in. Stars Hugo Weaving as the EchoMan and Alana de Roma as the young girl. Original format 35mm.

results.title: Darren's day out
results.brief_description:
A journey through Darren’s colorful Koori paintings of Gippsland. His images depict his visit to Metung rocks, Kalimna and an Emu Farm, and through text, Darren conveys his thoughts and impressions of his day out.
No dialogue only baclground sound effects.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Flux
results.brief_description:
A film about trust, about an accident, about falling out of love and about emerging from grief. Flux was created entirely on a desktop Macintosh using Adobe AfterEffects and Adobe Photoshop. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder. It is listed by Lynden Barber (film critic for The Australian newspaper) as one of ‘12 Film Breakthroughs’ for its achievement as the first Australian film post-produced entirely on a home computer.
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may disturb some viewers.

results.title: Boppo's bike ride
results.creator_credit: Ivan Couzens, Yaraan Bundle, Allan Parker and South West Institute of TAFE
results.brief_description:
A grandfather/grandaughter collaboration, this is one man’s journey through place and time from the 1930s-1960s. Ivan Couzens reminisces about the days when riding a bike was the only way to get around; school was a five mile ride away; and when he started work at the Bluestone quarries, the bicycle was his only mode of transport. A light-hearted look at the past interspersed with photographs and images of places once travelled. Music: “Greenflower” by Rob Bundle.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Dusty hearts
results.creator_credit: Pauline Chan, Mariel Beros and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Sax Elthan is a hapless musician, a refugee from the inner city. Rejected by his girlfriend, he travels to the outback to look for work. One burning Wednesday he finds himself beside a highway, waiting for a lift, contemplating his future. It arrives in the shape of a beat-up Volkswagon with a wardrobe tied to the roof. A black comedy about one man’s destiny starring Geoff Morrell (Blue Heelers, Changi). Also features Tina Bursill.
